results.title: My little angel
results.creator_credit: Chris Mansfield, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Chris Mansfield introduces his daughter to the family she is about to be born into. A big family with a diverse Indigenous history, Mansfield is looking forward to his new responsibility.

results.title: Pitcha this : life stories from A.S.H.E (Shepparton) : Digital Storytelling project
results.creator_credit: Brian Beckhurst, Chris Mansfield, Daniel McCrimmon, Helen Atkinson, Joel Atkinson, Misty Briggs, Natasha Craig, Tammy-Lee Atkinson, Troy Lovett, ACMI Digital Storytelling, VicHealth and ACMI
results.brief_description: Nine stories of the lives of students from Shepparton’s A.S.H.E (Academy of Sport, Health and Education), as created by the students as part of ACMI’s Digital Storytelling program. These students, also members of the Indigenous community, tell of their loves, ambitions and, mostly, of the family that support and sustain them.

results.title: Slave hunter = Rancheador
results.creator_credit: Sergio Giral and Instituto Cubano del Arte e Industrias Cinematográficos (ICAIC)
results.brief_description: Against the historic backdrop of the colonial slave era in the Caribbean and other parts of Latin America, the figure of the Rancheador (slave hunter) appeared as one of the most abominable exponents of the system. The Rancheador, the mercenary of his era, was in charge of hunting down runaway slaves, the cimarrones, and returning them to their owners, or if the hunt ended in death, bringing back the slave’s ear. Francisco Estevez, one of the bloodiest and most ambitious slave hunters in Cuban history, was hired by the rich landowners to police the interests of absentee sugar growers. This film is based on the diary of Estevez himself, who not only hunted down the runaway slaves in their palenques (communities concealed in the hills, made up of runaway slaves), but also used his henchmen to repress all outbursts of rebellion or desire for freedom of those either white or black, free or slave. ‘Rancheador’ is the second film of Giral’s Slave Trilogy that also includes ‘The Other Francisco’ (1974) and ‘Maluala’ (1979). Adapted from ‘Diary of a Rancheador’ by Villaverde. In Spanish with English subtitles.

results.title: Slaughterhouse five
results.creator_credit: George Roy Hill, Paul Monash and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by Kurt Vonnegut, an American P.O.W. is slipping into mental illness. Now a suburban optometrist, he has space/time fantasies, shifting between his experiences as a POW, including the bombing of Dresden, his life on another planet and his actual life. Michael Sacks plays Billy Pilgrim in a film shot in Czechoslovakia and Minnesota, which captures the complexity of Vonnegut’s work, and the despair of mental illness

results.title: Slate, Wyn and Me
results.creator_credit: Don McLennan, Tom Burstall and Ukiyo Films
results.brief_description: Having robbed a bank and killed a policeman, two brothers kidnap a girl who witnessed it all. Based on the novel, ” Slate and me and Blanche McBride” by Georgia Savage. Stars Sigrid Thornton, Simon Burke and Martin Sacks.

results.title: Sky trackers
results.creator_credit: John Power, Anthony Buckley and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: It started as innocent fun and turned into an adventure of galactic proportions! Ali (Maia Brewton) lives on a NASA Satellite Tracking Station where her Mum (Pamela Sue Martin) works as a space scientist. A computer whiz, Ali spends her spare time hacking into the station’s mainframe to record her personal diary. One evening while hacking into the computer she discovers a runaway satellite is out of control and heading straight for Earth and is likely to crash nearby. What she doesn’t know is that the satellite contains a load of deadly cargo, so dangerous it threatens the safety of the entire world…

results.title: Skipping class
results.creator_credit: Maureen McCarthy, Chris Warner and Trout Films
results.brief_description: A dramatised re-enactment of cultural conflict and the parent, student, teacher triangle. Steve is a seventeen year old, born in Macedonia and living in Australia, who is not doing well at school. He is caught in between a father, who has high hopes for him, and a burnt out teacher, and in the end it is Steve who suffers most.

results.title: Sky cries Mary until the grinders cease
results.creator_credit: A J Pruzan, Terry Amidei and Sky Cries Mary
results.brief_description: A pulsating montage of image and music from experimental music artists, Sky Cries Mary. Six pieces are performed - 1. Propergenda 2. Barh House 3. Und die flamen 4. Shakespeare factory 5. When fear stops 6. 9 Nite chant. All music is written and performed by Roderick Auer Stringfellow.

results.title: Sky at Westminster Abbey
results.brief_description: Recorded at a concert given to commemorate the 20th anniversary of the founding in Britain of Amnesty International. Performed in front of a live audience at the magnificent and atmospheric Westminster Abbey, this internationally acclaimed British rock band presents a fusion of rock and classical music ranging from the interpretive strains of electronic keyboards and synthesisers through to the poetic mellow sounds of acoustic guitars. Consisting of five extremely talented musicians (John Williams and Kevin Peek on classical and electric guitar, Herbie Flowers on bass guitar, Steve Gray on keyboards and synthesisers and Tristan Fry on percussion) and featuring breath-taking images of the wonderful gothic architectural environment that is Westminster Abbey, this video is most enjoyable, both visually and musically.
